org.jcvi.jillion.core.util

Class JoinedStringBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.util.JoinedStringBuilder<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<String>

    public final class JoinedStringBuilder<T>
extends Object
implements Builder<String>
    JoinedStringBuilder is a Builder that builds a single String object from a collection of Objects that can optionally be concatenated with another "glue" Object and/or prefixed and suffixed with other Objects. Objects to be joined use their Object.toString() method to get their String representation. unless otherwise told to transform it differently using the transform(Function).
    This class is not thread-safe.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <T> JoinedStringBuilder<T> create(Iterable<T> elements)
        Create a new JoinedStringBuilder instance that will join the given elements together in their iteration order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object being joined.
        Parameters:
        elements - the Objects to be joined. If an element is null, then it will be skipped during the join.

      • create

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> JoinedStringBuilder<T> create(T... elements)
        Create a new JoinedStringBuilder instance that will join the given elements together in their iteration order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object being joined.
        Parameters:
        elements - the Objects to be joined. If an element is null, then it will be skipped during the join.
        Returns:
        a new JoinedStringBuilder object; will never be null.

      • glue

        public JoinedStringBuilder<T> glue(Object glue)
        The given glue's Object.toString() is what is concatenated between the joined the elements.
        Parameters:
        glue - the String to put between concatenated elements, if glue is set to null then no glue will be used.
        Returns:
        this

      • prefix

        public JoinedStringBuilder<T> prefix(Object prefix)
        Prefix the objects to be joined with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix that will be in the resulting String before the objects are joined; or null if there should be no prefix.
        Returns:
        this

      • includeEmptyStrings

        public JoinedStringBuilder<T> includeEmptyStrings(boolean value)
        Change the behavior of how inner empty strings are handled, by default, empty strings will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        value - true if empty string should be included in the final built string; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this

      • suffix

        public JoinedStringBuilder<T> suffix(Object suffix)
        Suffix the objects to be joined with the given suffix.
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix that will be in the resulting String after the objects are joined; or null if there should be no suffix.
        Returns:
        this

      • transform

        public JoinedStringBuilder<T> transform(Function<T,String> transformer)
        Apply the given Transformation function to each value in the elements to join. If this method is not called, then the default transformation just calls each element's toString().
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
